nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: "The stacks of paper" is being personified as someone who can bear witness to something.

nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.name: Item_1
nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: "Western ears" symbolize people from Western countries.

nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.name: Item_2
nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: "A gallery of human faces" symbolizes a gathering of people of different origins.

nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.name: Item_3
nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: As we know a portrait does not have life. It is in a figurative way to say "a living portrait".

nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.name: Item_4
nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: The word "like" tells us that this part is a simile, comparing hats to small crowns.

nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.name: Item_5
nhmonkey.Recorder_-Input.value: "Two tiny birds" are clearly a metaphor for the girl's two small hands, showing that it was with loving care that the blind man held the girl's hands.
